newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela bolivar firms, market awash with dollars.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela bolivar firms, market awash with dollars.

text.p: The Venezuelan bolivar closed slightly firmer at 469.75/470.75 per dollar Monday, compared with 470.00/471.00 per dollar Friday, with large foreign currency supply on the interbank market making Central Bank intervention unnecessary, traders said.
"The market was dominated by offer, as in the last few sessions. There was also some demand (for foreign currency) which was met without the Central Bank having to step in," one said.
Traders said the high level of currency supply is temporary and likely to subside in coming weeks as demand for currency picks up to meet Christmas import orders.
